last_episode_to_air.name: Meal Mashups
last_episode_to_air.overview: The Kitchen crew mashes up some favorite meals and turns them into new and exciting culinary creations! A signature soup meets pasta bake in Jeff Mauro's French Onion Soup Mac and Cheese, and Geoffrey Zakarian brings a takeout staple to the morning with his Breakfast Fried Rice. Then, Sunny Anderson serves her Twice Baked Lasagna Potato, and Katie Lee Biegel has a sweet and creamy treat with her Candy Cheese Ball.

name: The Kitchen
overview: Spend a fun and food-filled morning in The Kitchen with hosts Sunny Anderson, Katie Lee, Jeff Mauro, Marcela Valladolid, and Geoffrey Zakarian. From simple supper ideas, food trend discussions, and family meal tips to trivia games and viewer questions, they'll cover all things fun in food.

episodes.name: Welcome to The Kitchen
episodes.overview: While Katie Lee makes Creamy Kale and Eggs for breakfast, the chefs discuss their New Year's resolutions. They also introduce and prepare delicious dishes to help viewers get dinner on the table. They debate the merits of several kitchen gadgets versus a good paring knife and Geoffrey Zakarian makes a Red Velvet Cocktail while the chefs dish on what they're "Into and Over" this week.

episodes.name: Cookbook Club
episodes.overview: Viewers' tweets are answered as the chefs prepare a delicious recipe featuring the most searched ingredients on foodnetwork.com; chicken, kale and quinoa. Sunny Anderson introduces Jenny McCoy as the first inductee of The Kitchen's Cookbook Club for her cookbook "Desserts for Every Season." Jeff Mauro helps Sunny Anderson with her Easy Cheesy Beefy Ravioli using pot roast cooked in a slow cooker. Geoffrey Zakarian makes The Perfect Manhattan as they all discuss what they're "Into and Over."

episodes.name: Wings Two Ways
episodes.overview: The hosts decide to peek inside each other's pantries and Marcela Valladolid makes Pan Seared Pork Chops With Pineapple and Couscous. Katie Lee and Jeff Mauro brave the cold to grill Salmon and Sunny Anderson and Geoffrey Zakarian make their favorite Wing recipes. Geoffrey gives his tips on muddling while mixing this week's delicious cocktail.

episodes.name: Conquer and Cook
episodes.overview: This week, Sunny Anderson shares her recipe for Creamy Chicken Succotash using frozen lima beans, and then chefs tackle foods most people avoid, like pomegranates, ginger and butternut ...

episodes.name: The Big Game
episodes.overview: The hosts of The Kitchen are getting ready for the big game with a ton of ideas for throwing the ultimate football party. Throughout the show a football stadium out of food will be ...

episodes.name: Easy Fixes for Dinner
episodes.overview: This week The Kitchen is all about easy fixes. Marcela makes chicken empanadas with pizza dough from the super market. Katie’s making fritatta using leftover potatoes, deli ham, peas and ...

episodes.name: Old Tools, New Ideas
episodes.overview: The Kitchen is full of new ideas this week starting with Sunny’s “1 Pan Plan”. Marcela’s got ‘Today’s Dinner, Tomorrow’s Lunchbox’, and the gang all find new uses for old tools like cookie ...

episodes.name: The Kitchen on Ice
episodes.overview: This week the Kitchen is on ice when special guest Brian Boitano stops by to make rigatoni with spicy chicken sausage, Jeff Mauro uses 3 ingredients from the freezer for a delicious dish and ...

episodes.name: The Kitchen Helpline
episodes.overview: The hosts are all about answering your questions. they give advice on how to fix viewers food fails and discuss DIY or buy while making hummus and salsa. Kelsey Nixon makes her sloppy Janes.

episodes.name: Family Traditions
episodes.overview: Katie kicks things off with a beef stew re-do and Geoffrey makes pesto rubbed baked salmon with cucumber and apple salad using our supermarket fix, pesto.

episodes.name: The Comeback Classic
episodes.overview: Sunny makes Bahamian peas and rice with bacon; Marcela makes ranch dressing; Katie makes guacamole; grilled pound cake with tequila-soaked pineapple; iceberg wedge salad.

episodes.name: Ultimate Meatloaf
episodes.overview: Jeff and Geoffrey team up to make ultimate meatloaf; tofu, eggplant and chiles; crispy Szechuan eggplant and tofu; cookbook author Haylie Duff makes chicken wrapped dates and herb mushroom crostini.

episodes.name: Martha Stewart Visits The Kitchen
episodes.overview: Martha Stewart stops by to share her recipe for a chocolate chip cookie icebox cake; blueberry pancakes; oregano burgers.

episodes.name: Spring Show
episodes.overview: Spring Pan-Sagna; ideas for leftover pork chops; asparagus five different ways; Marc Summers from "Rewrapped"; gin fizz; uses for hard boiled Easter eggs.

episodes.name: Fresh New Food Ideas
episodes.overview: Filling the freezer with make-ahead sausage and egg muffins; artichoke and shrimp tagliatelle pasta; bar snacks.

episodes.name: Cinco de Mayo With Bobby Flay
episodes.overview: Churro bar and tacos with Maile Carpenter, fiery shrimp fra diavolo, Bobby Flay makes an appearance for a Tool Takedown, and there are flaming lime shots and a piñata test.

episodes.name: Mother's Day Weekend
episodes.overview: The Kitchen celebrates Mother's Day weekend in style, starting with a great brunch for Mum when Katie cooks her breakfast bread pudding. Then Jeff makes his mum's beef braciole.

episodes.name: Help Is on the Way
episodes.overview: Potato Salad; new uses for kitchen tools; a no bake strawberry fool; foods with a bad rap; Mexico's national cocktail.

episodes.name: Weeknight Shortcuts
episodes.overview: The hosts of The Kitchen share shortcuts to help make your weeknight dinners easy. Jeff transforms deli-counter roast beef into sumptuous barbecue beef nachos.

episodes.name: The Grilling Show
episodes.overview: Grilling tips; grilled pizza two ways; spatchcocking a chicken for the grill; grill food failures; green beans four ways; a bonfire cocktail.

episodes.name: Old Fashioned
episodes.overview: An alternative to barbecue sauce, charred chimichurri; homemade vs. store bought croutons and hot sauce; stuffed tomato; honey gin cocktail.

episodes.name: It's Dad's Day With Rachael Ray
episodes.overview: Steak and eggs burrito; Rachael Ray hosts a segment called The Kitchen Toolbox; hot dogs; chocolate stout cake; last minute gift ideas for Father's Day.

episodes.name: The Chicken Rotisserie Show
episodes.overview: We are treating the crew today with some delicious fire roasted chicken. Katie revamps hot dogs and our hosts are testing out the latest kitchen gadgets.

episodes.name: The Burger Show
episodes.overview: Geoffrey makes the ultimate beef burger with a name you won't soon forget. The hosts decide that ordinary fries won't cut the mustard, and cook up out-of-this-world sides.

episodes.name: Summer Party
episodes.overview: Special guest Daniel Radcliffe stops by `The Kitchen' for our summer party show, and plays our first game of `build-a-burger'. The gang has tips and recipes for summer party entertaining.

episodes.name: The Corn Show
episodes.overview: Summer corn three ways; storing summer fruits and vegetables; tamales; guest chef Marc Murphy makes a seafood salad with scallops; a GZ cocktail.

episodes.name: So Fresh and So Green
episodes.overview: This episode is all about the freshest fruits and vegetables of the summer season. Jeff prepares a Grecian grilled chicken salad.

episodes.name: The Staycation Show
episodes.overview: Jerk Chicken; global gadgets gathered from culinary travels; lobster rolls; spa treatments made with ingredients from the kitchen; Korean BBQ party; strawberry-ginger daiquiri.

episodes.name: The Get-Together Show
episodes.overview: One pan plan for pork loin; puff pastry is taken to sweet and savory heights; three simple and packable party recipes; design guru Sabrina Soto offers party tips; classic margarita.

episodes.name: Summer Snack Show
episodes.overview: It's snack time and Katie Lee cooks up a cool and crispy snack with Food Network's most searched summer ingredient. Next we map out your summer road trip with car-ready snacks.

episodes.name: Cooking With Your Kids
episodes.overview: Fun new ways to cook with children; one stop snacks; food crafts that are fun to make and to eat; treats sweetened with healthy ingredients; the hosts' culinary word knowledge is put to the test.

episodes.name: Tomato Time
episodes.overview: The ultimate open-faced BLT with tomato roasted bacon and avocado; fried green tomato parmesan sandwich; farmer Lee Jones shares tomato tips and helps Sunny make a chilled red summer soup with heirloom tomatoes, watermelon and strawberries.

episodes.name: The Barbecue and Grilling Show
episodes.overview: It's all about barbecue and grilling today on The Kitchen, starting off with incredible dino ribs and great cuts of pork for the grill.

episodes.name: The Back to School Show
episodes.overview: A freezer fix with a back to school groove; new spins on peanut butter and jelly; Joey Fatone from "Rewrapped" stops by; mastering chilaquiles; toasted marshmallow milkshake.

episodes.name: Quick and Easy
episodes.overview: Frozen ravioli is used to created chipotle lasagna; tips for adding zest to weeknight meals; guest Ching-He Huang stir fries up a quicker-than-take out kung pao chicken.

episodes.name: Fresh Fall
episodes.overview: A celebration of the best ingredients of the fall; homemade pumpkin spiced lattes with Maile Carpenter; prosciutto-wrapped halibut; Mo Rocca helps make short rib and spinach-stuffed raviolis.

episodes.name: Oktoberfest
episodes.overview: A celebration of Oktoberfest; bratwurst sandwich with a side of red cabbage kraut; testing kitchen gadgets from Germany; dressing up pretzels with delicious dips; Black Forest cake; a German radlermass.

episodes.name: Grown-Up Comfort Food
episodes.overview: Apple butter-braised pork chops; red wine braised short ribs; baked BLT mac and cheese and stovetop mac and cheese with mushrooms and thyme; Laura Vitale whips up Italian cannoli.

episodes.name: Homecoming
episodes.overview: Texas chili con carne; basic cooking rules; ramen two new ways; fixes for common recipe mishaps; sweet and savory microwave treats; a new spin on and old college drink.

episodes.name: Sweets and Treats
episodes.overview: A strange new food trend; pumpkin roll up; the Maniac Pumpkin Carvers demonstrate carving basics; a supermarket fix with an eerie twist; transforming Halloween candy; spooky sangria.

episodes.name: Souped-Up Soups
episodes.overview: Marcela's beef stew; viewers' soup making questions are answered, including tips on how to get the richest flavor in every pot and how to fancy up store-bought soups; a warm Fall Fashioned cocktail.

episodes.name: The Harvest
episodes.overview: Pork loin; tasty ways to whip up cauliflower; Food Network's Nancy Fuller shares slow cooker recipes; using fall's bounty to create one-stop snacks; a bourbon apple cider.

episodes.name: Thanksgiving Prep
episodes.overview: Make-ahead recipes and tips for a relaxing Thanksgiving; Maile Carpenter offers a look inside Food Network Magazine, including a peak at some of the most outrageous turkey trends; Thanksgiving time line tips; dessert offerings; pumpkin recipes.

episodes.name: Thanksgiving Feast
episodes.overview: Tips for cooking the perfect turkey and turkey day staples; no-bake cranberry fluff pie; tips for setting a simple and festive table; "Chopped" judges Marc Murphy and Alex Guarnaschelli shed light on the Share Our Strength's No Kid Hungry Campaign.

episodes.name: Easy Entertaining
episodes.overview: Thanksgiving leftovers are used to make turkey gumbo; time saving uses for the slow cooker; spicing up coffee; enchiladas suiza.

episodes.name: Deck the Halls
episodes.overview: Recipes and ideas for DIY gift giving; crown roast of pork with sausage and sage stuffing; gift giving tips; clementine and cranberry glazed Cornish game hens; building a showcase gingerbread home; pumpkin flip cocktail.

episodes.name: Holiday Time
episodes.overview: Holiday ham; easy hors d'oeuvres; Quvenzhane Wallis and her costars offer up a preview of the new movie "Annie"; holiday cookie-decorating; champagne tower.

episodes.name: Healthy Fresh Start
episodes.overview: Food Network's Katherine Alford shares new food trends; lightened up recipes; veggie lasagna; portion control tips; powered up post workout snacks; pavlova; cucumber cocktail.

episodes.name: Brunch It Up
episodes.overview: Brunch ideas including oven-baked Dutch Baby; new ways to use pomegranate; the secrets to making eggs Benedict for a crowd; brunch Bellini.

episodes.name: Waste Not ...
episodes.overview: Money-saving tips including a bacon cheeseburger casserole freezer fix; using up vegetables; maximizing the panty's potential; Daphne Brogdon reinvents a leftover dessert; white wine spritzer.

episodes.name: Gearing Up for Game Day
episodes.overview: The crew is huddling up to get prepped and ready for a big game bash. They've got fresh party-planning tips, and big ideas for use with a slow cooker, and two game-day dishes to wow the crowd.

episodes.name: Snow Day Cooking
episodes.overview: The Kitchen is livening up with winter favourites, starting with Geoffrey Zakarian's luscious ricotta gnocchi. Then, the hosts test the latest kitchen gadgets, and three weeknight potato dishes get a boost.

episodes.name: Sweets for Your Sweetie
episodes.overview: It's a Valentine's Day celebration with plenty of chocolate on this episode of The Kitchen. The hosts prepare a romantic meal with Geoffrey Zakarian's Dark Chocolate Mousse, a tender filet mignon with mushroom red wine sauce from Katie Lee, and two mouthwatering side dishes from Marcela Valladolid and Jeff Mauro. The Kitchen crew gets crafty with new ideas for valentines made out of chocolate, including adorable chocolate kiss critters and edible chocolate vessels. A master chocolatier joins in on the fun with a silky-smooth dark chocolate truffle recipe and out-of-this-world flavors to spice it up! Geoffrey caps it all off with his take on a chocolate martini.

episodes.name: Rise and Shine
episodes.overview: The Kitchen helps you rise and shine with fresh new ideas for your breakfasts. Sunny Anderson shares her favorite breakfast of all time: Insta Huevos Rancheros. The hosts answer viewers' egg, pancake and make-ahead breakfast conundrums, and oats get their a-ha moment with three delicious ideas for your morning oatmeal. Geoffrey Zakarian shares his recipe for incredible homemade gravlax — the ultimate topper for our bagel bar. And we're putting time back into your hectic weekday mornings with our timesaving breakfast hacks. Geoffrey goes healthy for his 5 O'clock Somewhere with a delicious kale and grape green smoothie.

episodes.name: Warming Winter Meals
episodes.overview: Settle in and get cozy because it's comfort food all day on The Kitchen. GZ starts off the show with a delicious Sunday Supper of Spaghetti and Meatballs. The gang shows us how to maximize our microwave's potential with some wow worthy tips. It's chocolate heaven with Marcela's Sweet Retreat: The Ultimate Brownie. And Sunny and Katie top it all off with their amazing Brownie Sundaes. Chef Amanda Freitag joins us with her mouthwatering patty melt. Our hosts create crazy comfort food mash ups. GZ toasts New York with his throwback cocktail and the gang tries some yummy new snacks.

episodes.name: Winter Fix
episodes.overview: Jeff Mauro cooks up a traditional family favorite, Chicken Tortellini Soup, and Food Network.com has new and tasty ways to lighten up three of your favorite dishes. Geoffrey Zakarian teaches us a kitchen basic mother sauce, while Marcela Valladolid and Katie Lee keep it healthy and delicious with their grain bowl recipes. We'll show you a few overlooked ingredients that you just might like, and Geoffrey wraps it all up with his warm Maple and Rum Toddy while the hosts get popping with fantastic ways to top popcorn.

episodes.name: Special Family Gatherings
episodes.overview: We're throwing a surprise baby shower for Marcela Valladolid on this episode of The Kitchen! We'll share our tips for hosting all kinds of special family celebrations and Marcela makes a perfect party main dish with her puff pastry-wrapped salmon. We're putting together creative new ideas for DIY hostess gifts, and Katie Lee and Sunny Anderson have two delicious and time-saving rice side dishes. The gang shares their finger food appetizer favorites and Katie creates a beautiful party-worthy Croquembouche. We toast Marcela with a virgin Cucumber Ginger Fizz and surprise her with a fun shower present!

episodes.name: Top O' the Morning
episodes.overview: A celebration of St. Patrick's Day with a twist on the classic Irish dish, corn beef and cabbage; two easy meals using the potato; tipsy treats with a secret ingredient; St. Paddy's Day cocktail.

episodes.name: Freezer Fixes and Pantry Staples
episodes.overview: Shrimp and grits; Debi Mazar and Gabriele Corcos from "Extra Virgin" make pantry pasta; recipes using condensed milk; what to and what not to throw out from the refrigerator; pickleback cocktail.

episodes.name: Happy Easter!
episodes.overview: The Kitchen celebrates Easter with two classic holiday dishes: Geoffrey Zakarian's stuffed pork loin and Marcela Valladolid's leg of lamb. Pastry Chef Johnny Iuzzini shows us a new twist on the carrot cake. Plus, fun and edible food crafts for your holiday table and innovative ideas on how to use your leftover Easter eggs. Lastly, Geoffrey shares his Easter punch.

episodes.name: April Favorites
episodes.overview: Leftover holiday ham recipe; one pan chicken dinner; fried matzo brei; no-guilt holiday desserts; tips on knife shopping.

episodes.name: Early Spring Entertaining
episodes.overview: Blackened hanger steak; Tiffani Thiessen shares her tips for an at-home pizza party; quick and easy snacks on the go; hiding healthy ingredients in decadent desserts; planting a kitchen herb garden; herb-infused cocktail.

episodes.name: Spring Cooking
episodes.overview: Tips on grilling chicken breast to perfection and growing fresh produce from kitchen scraps; dry and wet spice rubs; baker Gesine Bullock-Prado makes maple cream pie; a tipsy sweet tea; food fire starters.

episodes.name: Fresh Fix-Ins
episodes.overview: Easy weeknight meals using only one pan; kabobs with two sauces; grilled cheese; kitchen do's and don'ts; lemon-inspired cocktail.

episodes.name: Spicy Favorites
episodes.overview: A spicy southern classic dish, hot chicken; the difference between Tex-Mex and Mexican tacos; chef Marc Murphy serves up a spicy skirt steak; spicy sweets; spicy margarita.

episodes.name: Celebrate Mom
episodes.overview: Celebrate Mother's Day with the easy but fancy brunch dish, baked eggs with green chilies. Make mom a last-minute gift with candy, plus a foolproof guide to making the perfect chocolate chip cookie. There's unexpected ways to use a cupcake tray to make quick dinners and two ways to use pesto. Finally, a cocktail mom will love.

episodes.name: Deck Party
episodes.overview: We're revealing our new deck and showing you how to grill the perfect steak. Create a colorful pasta salad with seasonal vegetables and learn two recipes with jarred and fresh artichokes. There's compound butter to spice up your meals and ideas for what to make with the last scoop in the jar. Plus, a gin punch.

episodes.name: Memorial Day Bash
episodes.overview: For your first summer barbecue, there's a great new recipe for a killer burger and barbecue ribs. Discover some unique fries with sweet and savory dips. There are timesaving tricks for food prep and actor David Burtka shares the secrets for great homemade ice cream sandwiches. Plus, poolside snacks and a classic Long Island Ice Tea.

episodes.name: Backyard Cookout
episodes.overview: Fire up the grill for a delicious Alabama White Sauce Chicken recipe and then see how to doctor up store-bought barbecue sauce. Geoffrey Zakarian shows how to grill a lobster and Katie Lee has a colorful quinoa side salad. Plus, tips to set up the perfect barbecue buffet, grill trends, answers to your most common grill questions, and a Tequila Sunrise.

episodes.name: Must-Have Meals
episodes.overview: Geoffrey Zakarian kicks off the show with a braised chicken with caramelized lemons, dates and pine nuts. Then, recipes using the pita and celebrate summer with a strawberry shortcake. Dr. Travis Stork shows us how to cure common summer ailments with food. Plus, three ingredients you have to try, tipsy treats, and a strawberry smash cocktail.

episodes.name: Recipes for Success
episodes.overview: The day starts with a no-fail technique for juicy grilled pork chops and pineapple salsa, then learn how to use seasonal fruits and vegetables in a grilled summer salad. Cookbook author and blogger Shauna Sever serves up a Honeyed Yogurt Cheesecake. The hosts offer up easy substitutions when you're missing an ingredient and find out just how bad your kitchen habits are. Plus, a unique way to blend a Strawberry Daiquiri.

episodes.name: Father's Day Feast
episodes.overview: Celebrate dad with smoked Italian Sausage Hoagies, and a Flank Steak Fajita with Chimichurri and Drunken Peppers. There are simple suggestions on how to take pretzels and chips to the next level, and how to make a homemade banana split ice cream cake. Plus, a special dad edition of Tool Takedown, kitchen-themed Father's Day gifts and toast dad with a classic Whiskey Sour.

episodes.name: A Taste of Summer
episodes.overview: Recipes for summer include a diablo stuffed burger, two different potato salads and the perfect pina cocktail. Also: Kathie Lee Gifford makes a peach-and-rhubarb crostata; tips are given for sprucing up a supermarket flower bouquet; and the hosts share their must-have items for the beach.

episodes.name: Summer Celebration
episodes.overview: The hosts throw a summer celebration. Guests Bobby and Jamie Deen stop by with a molasses-marinated London broil. Also on the menu: grilled butterflied chicken with macaroni salad; three party-pleasing dips; edible crafts; a watermelon margarita.

episodes.name: Summer Staples
episodes.overview: Marcela Valladolid cooks steamed clams with chorizo and tequila; the hosts suggest new uses for old kitchen tools; condiment flavors are kicked up a notch; and guest Damaris Phillips demonstrates how to make a buffalo chicken pasta salad. Other segments highlight pineapple, s'mores and a rum rickie recipe.

episodes.name: Summer Seafood
episodes.overview: Geoffrey Zakarian demonstrates his paella and Royal Blush drink recipes; and the hosts share their beat-the-heat secrets. Also: two summer salads; new ideas for dressing different lettuces; pop-up parties with Nate Berkus; and a guide to grilling fish.

episodes.name: Pool Party
episodes.overview: El pastor-style pork tenderloin is prepared, along with two tomato side dishes. Also: Melissa Gilbert shares her fried chicken recipe; "Food Network Star" finalists compete to make the best poolside snack; and the Bloody Mary receives a summer twist.

episodes.name: Kid-Friendly Recipes
episodes.overview: Tips for cooking with kids are offered by the hosts, who also prepare chicken-and-avocado sliders and new takes on ice cream sundaes. Also: John Besh makes an easy school-night dinner.

episodes.name: The Kitchen Reveal
episodes.overview: The Kitchen set is revealed with its new autumn colours. Dishes include Marcela's seasonal vegetable lasagne, Geoffrey's vinaigrette, Katie's summer crab cakes and a classic cocktail.

episodes.name: Farewell to Summer
episodes.overview: Wings two ways; easy solutions to common barbecue dilemmas; no cream-creamed corn; grilled corn and poblano salad; grilled jumbo shrimp with a 1-2-3 glaze; desserts on the grill; uses for pickle brine; frozen raspberry and vodka lemonade.

episodes.name: Back to School Menu
episodes.overview: School night pasta dinner; easy back-to-school snacks made with cereal; quick on-the-go breakfasts; English muffin pizzas; new ways to organize for the school year using common household items; an appletini.

episodes.name: Fast Fixes
episodes.overview: Cold noodle salmon salad; time-saving food preparation hacks; two meals cooked on sheet trays; rosemary and thyme chicken with carrots and potatoes; tri-tip salad; carnitas; Valerie Bertinelli stops by to make her easy chocolate sauce; gin and tonic.

episodes.name: First Taste of Fall
episodes.overview: Join the hosts of Food Network's The Kitchen as we celebrate autumn's bounty with delicious recipes using Brussels sprouts and acorn squash, and toast the season with `Fall Floats'.

episodes.name: Tackle Your Tailgate
episodes.overview: Grilled Buffalo chicken pizza; planning and packing for a tailgating party; three dips that are easy to transport; NASCAR driver Danica Patrick makes cheddar grilled cheese; a Black Velvet Bear cocktail; tailgate gadgets.

episodes.name: Autumn Essentials
episodes.overview: Jeff Mauro's United States of Meatloaf; two winter squash recipes; spaghetti tossed with butternut squash; roasted spaghetti squash with curried shallot butter; popular French dish, moules frites; Blood and Sand cocktail and a lesson in whiskey 101.

episodes.name: Living for Fall
episodes.overview: Food Network's Katherine Alford stops by to share the trends for autumn. The hosts share favourite kitchen hacks, new uses for crescent roll dough and learn how to make a fall wreath. Plus, get flavourful ways to pep up pumpkin seeds.

episodes.name: Scary Good Recipes
episodes.overview: It's a Halloween party in The Kitchen as the hosts share two ways to jazz up supermarket apple cider doughnuts, as well as perfect crafts and tips for your Halloween party. But can they survive a terrifying touch test?

episodes.name: Flavors of Fall
episodes.overview: The Kitchen explores fall flavours to celebrate the season. Recipes include classic Mexican chili rellenos, autumn-flavoured fried wontons, autumn soups and cavatelli and vodka sauce. The hosts also test holiday baking gadgets.

episodes.name: Comforting Classics
episodes.overview: The Kitchen gang finds comfort in a decadent mac and cheese and two twists on banana bread. They share sweet slow cooker hacks, and Amanda Freitag makes a classic pork on pork. Finally, they savour a hot buttered rum cocktail.

episodes.name: Turkey Day Timeline
episodes.overview: The Thanksgiving turkey timeline; Martha Stewart makes stuffed mushrooms; Mexican chocolate pecan pie; cranberry sweet potatoes; decorating tips for the Thanksgiving table; last-minute hostess gift ideas; Toronto cocktails.

episodes.name: Tribute to Turkey
episodes.overview: With less than a week to Thanksgiving, it's all about turkey in The Kitchen. Recipes include ranch turkey, deep-fried turkey, chestnut stuffing and an espresso martini. Plus, turkey-themed food crafts that will wow a crowd.

episodes.name: Deck Your Halls With Delicious
episodes.overview: Porcini-rubbed roast beef and two potato sides, perfect for a holiday party; actress Regina King helps make cheesecake with pomegranate sauce; holiday wreaths made with household items; cranberry lemonade punch cocktail.

episodes.name: Cookie Swap Party!
episodes.overview: A cookie swap party featuring chocolate peppermint whoopie pies, mini sugar cookie tarts and cookie truffles; Duff Goldman demonstrates how to make gingerbread cookies like a pro; eggnog cocktail; packaging holiday cookies.

episodes.name: Seasons Eatings
episodes.overview: Emeril Lagasse makes a holiday rack of lamb with apple mint puree; Christmas tree cheese ball; snowman cheese ball; yule log cake; tips for decorating a store-bought gingerbread house; peppermint hot chocolate.

episodes.name: Winter Favorites
episodes.overview: Slow cooker beef stew; oatmeal latte and savory oatmeal risotto with mushroom and mint; the Today Show's Natalie Morales makes her chocolate winter flan; black Russian cocktail.

episodes.name: Delicious and Nutritious
episodes.overview: Turkey bolognese with veggie noodles; beet burger with citrus caper aioli; lesser-known healthy ingredients; 100-calorie snacks; preparing some intimidating healthy foods; chocolate cupcakes with a secret ingredient; carrot ginger sparkler.

episodes.name: Bringing Breakfast Back
episodes.overview: Mimosa sunset cocktail; baked eggs with salami, mozzarella, olives and garlic bread; protein packed recipes; chef Anne Burrell makes crepes with mascarpone and chocolate with a cherry compote; decoding egg cartons; coffee tricks.

episodes.name: Savor the Savings
episodes.overview: Tips for freezing food; pork osso bucco; weeknight dinners using affordable chicken thighs; Kardea Brown makes curry coconut chickpea soup; mix-ins to enhance inexpensive liquor; demystifying grocery store offers.

episodes.name: Stuffed
episodes.overview: Picadillo stuffed peppers; popular stuffed tools; goat cheese and herb stuffed chicken breast; ham and cheese stuffed chicken breast; food blogger Nicole Friday makes apple, pear and walnut stuffed French toast; a Bloody Mary with a stuffed garnish.

episodes.name: Football Feast
episodes.overview: Seattle dog; eggplant hero; Buffalo chicken hoagie; party-planning playbook; bourbon brown sugar stuffed sweet potato skins; Adrian Davila brings his pulled pork all the way from Texas.

episodes.name: Winter Escape
episodes.overview: Pork kebobs and baked pineapple rice; upside-down mango cake; makeup mogul Bobbi Brown shows how to pamper yourself using pantry items; Scorpion Bowl cocktail; chef Julius Jackson makes coconut shrimp and mango sauce.

episodes.name: Chock Full of Chocolate
episodes.overview: Devil's food cake and new ways to make treats with chocolate bars; creme brulee; chocolate cherry pudding pops; Rev Run and his wife, Justine, introduce a cocoa-rubbed strip steak for two; chocolate whiskey martini; edible flower bouquets.

episodes.name: Award Season Party
episodes.overview: Wolfgang Puck shares the most popular after party dish; surf and turf rib eye crostini with gorgonzola mousse; recipes using popcorn; Food Network Magazine's Maile Carpenter previews the latest issue; strawberry chocolate mini trifles.

episodes.name: Southern Comforts
episodes.overview: Fried chicken; dos and don'ts for deep frying; baked sweet corn; sweet tea cocktail; chef Lazarus Lynch makes a crowd-pleasing 'Bama chocolate mousse; the hosts give their verdicts on fried, decadent foods.

episodes.name: Restaurant Favorites
episodes.overview: Stuffed crust cast iron pizza with smoked mozzarella; crispy fish tacos; chef Judy Joo makes pork belly cheesesteak; viewer questions about take-out favorites; bartending tricks; beer-garita.

episodes.name: Pi(e) Day
episodes.overview: A celebration of Pi Day featuring a classic chicken pot pie, a breakfast pie mashup, lolli-pies, and lemon meringue with a twist; the latest pie trends; testing pie tools; a sweet apple pie shooter.

episodes.name: Spring Spread
episodes.overview: A celebration of Easter with a sausage and spinach bone-in pork loin and an adorable bunny cake; decorating Easter eggs and easy DIY spring wreaths; Debi Mazar and Gabriele Corcos make a spring risotto; spring fling cocktail.

episodes.name: Our Tastiest Makeovers

episodes.overview: The Kitchen shares fun recipes for the hottest days of summer. The refreshing dishes include Easy Roasted Green Gazpacho, Strawberry Balsamic BLT and Grilled Swordfish with Mango Salsa. Plus, Watermelon Granita Parfait is the perfect summer dessert.

episodes.name: Labor Day BBQ
episodes.overview: Tips for making Pork Roast Sandwiches with Spicy Apricot Mustard; Quadruple Illinois Sweet Corn Salad; Hot Dog "Burnt Ends." Alex Guarnaschelli prepares Tomato and Herby Mozzarella Salad; Katie Lee with her Chocolate Strawberry Shortcake.

episodes.name: Simple Speedy Dishes
episodes.overview: Grilled chicken parmesan; Alex Guarnaschelli shares a pork, tofu and vegetable stir fry; Jeff Mauro shows his original Chicago cheese steak with Taylor Street cheese sauce; cod with brown butter lemon sauce; easy mussels and shrimp paella pouches.

episodes.name: Our Best Big Batch Recipes
episodes.overview: Jeff Mauro starts with his escarole, sausage, peppers and beans cheat sheet; Geoffrey Zakarian makes a big batch of his ratatouille; big easy chicken and andouille file gumbo; Alex Guarnaschelli's pork chops pizzaiola can turn into multiple meals.

episodes.name: Green Curry with Shrimp
episodes.overview: Comfy and cozy meals; Geoffrey Zakarian's harissa and fennel marinated lamb chops; Jeff Mauro's green curry with shrimp; Katie Lee's turkey meatloaf; Sunny Anderson's Tex-Mex chili mac skillet; Alex Guarnaschelli's loaded vegetable quesadillas.

episodes.name: Haunt Your Home
episodes.overview: Easy ideas for a ghoulishly good Halloween with smoky butternut queso dip, sunflower butter cups, bloody beef fingers, a decadent and festive pumpkin pie crème brûlée served in mini pumpkins.

episodes.name: #KitchenGoals
episodes.overview: Kitchen hosts are taking on viral trends; Jeff Mauro makes Chicago pizza pot pie with pepperoni sauce and baby bella mushrooms; Alex Guarnaschelli makes her Monte Cristo breakfast sandwich; garden focaccia; five-ingredient stuffed slider bake.

episodes.name: Fall Throwdown
episodes.overview: Kitchen hosts are cooking and tasting favourite fall produce; easy cheese and cranberry stuffed grilled chicken; farro and butternut squash salad; rutabaga, turnip and pear gratin; chicken sausage with apples, sage and cabbage.

episodes.name: Fall for Your Pantry
episodes.overview: Seasonal dishes using pantry staples; chicken bolognese; popovers with sesame butter and spiced pear jam; German-style sweet potato salad; lentil salad with mushrooms and pink lady apples; spicy bean dip.

episodes.name: No-Rules-Giving
episodes.overview: Katie's Bacon Wrapped Turkey Breast with "Stuffing" Croutons; Sunny's Cornish Game Hens and Veggie Holiday Cheat Sheet; Twice-Baked Sweet Potatoes with Sausage and Ricotta; Thanksgiving Chimichanga; Thanksgiving Sundae; Frozen Apple Pie Margarita.

episodes.name: Turkey Day To-Do List
episodes.overview: Whole roasted turkey with sumac, lemon and thyme, plus gravy; charred orange cranberry relish; spinach and artichoke stuffed sweet potatoes; cornbread dressing with sausage and mushrooms; pumpkin spice latte pie; decor ideas and wine tips.

episodes.name: Holiday Hall of Fame
episodes.overview: Ginger chili glazed ham with a flambe finish; loaded mashed potato bar; pistachio and pomegranate cheese log with pomegranate glaze; easy cherry pistachio biscotti cookies; Christmas sweater cookies; pomegranate punch.

episodes.name: Cookies and Mocktails
episodes.overview: The hosts play Secret Santa for family and friends, surprising them with delicious food gifts; spinach artichoke dip pasta bake; coconut maple granola; holiday stroopwafel latte; the travelling cookie tin makes its way to singer Meghan Trainor.

episodes.name: Home for the Holidays
episodes.overview: Pastrami-rubbed short ribs; beefed-up charred veggie and cheese grits; roasted vegetables with herbed feta, pistachio and pomegranate; sausage and parmesan arancini; chocolate rum balls; cookbook author Eden Grinshpan.

episodes.name: A Kitchen Carol
episodes.overview: Pork crown roast with roasted potato and vegetables; smokey bar nut mix; flaming provolone with parsley toast; peppermint skillet cake; blood orange sherry cobbler cocktail punch.

episodes.name: Brunchday Funday
episodes.overview: Lambrusco spritz sangria; smoked salmon eggs Benedict with sauce Maltaise; country-style eggs Benedict; cannoli-style ricotta toast; easy bacon, peppers and cheese home fries; powdered-style cake donuts; melted coffee ice cream latte.

episodes.name: Food Forecast
episodes.overview: "The Kitchen" hosts share their predictions for which supermarket veggies will rocket from staple to superstar this year; they make eggplant parmesan boats and vegetable top salad with walnut dressing, and actress Maureen McCormick stops by to chat.

episodes.name: Winter Weeknight Wins
episodes.overview: The Kitchen tackles a week's worth of warming winter dinners, starting with Fusilli with Sausage and Oyster Mushrooms. There's also an Easy Beef French Dip with Quick Jus, Sheet Pan Blackened Salmon with Garlicky Kale and Strawberry Crostata.

episodes.name: Step Up The Savings
episodes.overview: The Kitchen is stepping up the savings to make flavourful meals on a budget, starting with Cheat Sheet Chorizo Panzanella. There's also Spaghetti with Clams, slow-cooked Adobo Chicken and fancy-yet-frugal English Pea and Sweet Onion Risotto.

episodes.name: Breakfast All Day
episodes.overview: The Kitchen is celebrating breakfast and satisfying all taste buds with Spicy Eggs in Purgatory and sweet Peaches and Cream Pancakes. The menu also includes Larger Than Life Scones and Breakfast Nachos using waffle fries.

episodes.name: Ooey-Gooey Goodness
episodes.overview: The versatility of cheese, starting with a French Onion Soup Burger and Baked Brie Topped with Savory Granola and Fruit. There are also Chiles Rellenos and, for dessert, Ginger Lemon Basque Cheesecake with Lemon Curd Topping.

episodes.name: Stadium Staples
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts reveal how to recreate favourite stadium eats at home! There are Nunya Business Chili Cheese Fries and Pimento Cheese-Stuffed Soft Pretzels as well as Beef and Roasted Poblano Empanadas and Pickled Jalapeno Corn Dogs.

episodes.name: Sweet Ways to Celebrate
episodes.overview: The Kitchen is sharing all the sweet ways to celebrate Valentine's Day and make it feel extra special. After a meal of Sake and Miso-Marinated Salmon with Coconut Rice and Broccolini, there's a Brownie Tart, Mint Chocolate Bonbons and more.

episodes.name: Dinner in a Pinch
episodes.overview: The Kitchen is focusing on fast and easy meals that are unbelievably good, too! The menu includes Bucatini Carbonara, Turkey Piccata and No Bake Chocolate Hazelnut Cheesecake, and the hosts share some store-bought shortcuts that feel homemade.

episodes.name: Skillets, Bakes and Casseroles
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts are sharing their favourite regional casseroles, bakes and skillets -- with fresh side dish options, too. The menu includes New York-inspired Cheesy Spinach Manicotti with Lemon and a Southern Chili Cornbread Skillet.

episodes.name: Classics Worth Cooking
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts are breaking down the classic dishes that every home cook can master in their own kitchens. There's No-Fail Whole Roasted Chicken, Salad Nicoise, a T-Bone Steak with Easy Bearnaise Sauce; Chili Orange Chocolate Souffle for dessert.

episodes.name: Starch Madness
episodes.overview: The Kitchen's epic, starch-filled menu leaves no carb behind! It starts off with Beer Cheese Soup in a Bread Bowl with Kielbasa Croutons and then includes a Pierogi Pizza, Fettuccine Alfredo Pie and a fun Pasta Personality Test.

episodes.name: Recipes by Request
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts are taking requests for easy, new and creative recipes, starting with Easy Smothered Chicken and Grilled Red Curry Lamb Chops. There's also a perfect Chocolate Cake with Easy Chocolate Frosting.

episodes.name: Spring to It!
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts share simple, seasonal dinners for every night of the week, starting with Cavatelli with Asparagus, Lemon and Fresh Ricotta. There's also a family-friendly Easy Wedge Salad, Black Sea Bass En Papillote and Magic Mousse for dessert.

episodes.name: Switch Up Your Spring Feast
episodes.overview: The Kitchen is rewriting the rule book for a spring feast with fun, new recipes that include Jalapeno Honey Ham, Easy Rosemary Deviled Potatoes and Chocolate Matzoh Bark for dessert. Plus, the hosts craft beautiful and simple Metallic Easter Eggs.

episodes.name: The Kitchen's Essentials
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts are sharing essential dishes and pro tips for every home cook; Classic Shrimp Scampi and Chocolate Croissant Bread Pudding. Plus, Chef Cliff Crooks stops by to help the hosts tackle some common cooking do's and don'ts.

episodes.name: Let's Get Green!
episodes.overview: The Kitchen is going green with seasonal recipes and sustainable ingredients. The dishes include Lentil Stuffed Peppers, Broccoli Stem Salad and a Ratatouille Sandwich. Plus, the hosts create an Indoor Vertical Herb Garden and try upcycled snacks.

episodes.name: Spice It Up!
episodes.overview: The Kitchen is firing on all cylinders with spicy, flavorful recipes, including a fried chicken sandwich with gochujang glaze, chipotle carrot soup and shrimp cocktail with lemon; chef Duff Goldman stops by to chat about his new show.

episodes.name: Mother's Day Made Easy
episodes.overview: The Kitchen is giving Mom the day off and making Mother's Day easy. There's a Bacon, Onion and Cheese Tart, a shortcut sheet pan Chicken A L'Orange and Limoncello Ginger Tiramisu, and the hosts create beautiful, colourful fruit boards.

episodes.name: A Spin on Spring
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts spin the Seasonal Wheel of Produce to create recipes showcasing their favourite spring ingredients, including asparagus and rhubarb, in delicious new ways. Chrissy Teigen's mum, Pepper, stops by with the scoop on her new cookbook.

episodes.name: License to Grill
episodes.overview: The Kitchen is grilling up the summer's best recipes, including Grilled Tomatoes with Scallions, Chives and Ricotta and Grilled Corn and Farro Salad. Cakealikes judge Kalen Allen stops by to share his opinions on the season's grilling trends.

episodes.name: Thanks a Brunch, Dad!
episodes.overview: The Kitchen serves up a scrumptious brunch that any dad will love. The hosts make Everything Bagel Breakfast Casserole, a Strawberry Pandowdy, Hazelnut Shakerato coffee cocktails and the perfect Father's Day mug cake.

episodes.name: Cook-Out of Control
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts are amping up summer foods for an epic summer celebration. Their cookout menu includes Triple Decker Burgers with Roasted Vegetables and Cheese Sauce, Lobster Roll Panzanella and Grilled Biscuit Sundae with Peaches and Blueberries.

episodes.name: Picnic Palooza
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts serve up packable eats for the beach, park, pool or a hike; they make Picnic Fried Chicken with Honey Giardiniera Butter, Curried Chickpea Salad Pitas and Chilled Melon, Cucumber and Mint Salad; tips for outdoor feasting.

episodes.name: Greenmarket Game Plan
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts share recipes to take greenmarket ingredients from the farm stand to the table; they make Spicy Chicken Eggplant Boats, Roasted Carrots with Carrot Top Pesto and Spinach and Swiss Chard Stew with Coconut Curry Greens and Lentils.

episodes.name: Fresh and Fast Feast
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts share easy, breezy summer recipes, including Everything-But-The-Kitchen-Sink Pizza and Chicken Stir Fry with Spicy Peanut Sauce. Food Network Obsessed podcast host Jaymee Sire stops by to chat about viral food trends.

episodes.name: Noodle Mania
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts simmer, twirl and slurp their way through oodles of noodle dishes. There's Fresh Fettuccine with Spicy Crab and Spring Onion, ooey-gooey Wagon Wheel Western BBQ Mac and Cheese and even Easy Cinnamon Sugar Crispy Noodles for dessert.

episodes.name: Summer Checklist
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts create the ultimate summer checklist filled with must-have dishes to enjoy before the season ends. They make Sticky Tamarind Ribs, Triple Tomato Salad and Plum and Black Cherry Buttermilk Shortcake and chat with Robert Irvine, too.

episodes.name: Summer BBQ Finale
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts work together on a Labor Day cookout, each bringing a unique ingredient or technique to make the menu tasty and memorable. The spread includes Spicy Green Goddess Burgers, Hibachi-Style Hot Dogs and Spiked Lemony Iced Tea.

episodes.name: Pick Your Own
episodes.overview: Each host cooks with their favourite fall produce. They make everything from Pan Roasted Chicken and Pear Slaw to Cavatappi with Sausage, Kale and Mushrooms. Chef Carla Hall stops by to chat about Halloween and share her squash tips.

episodes.name: Back to Cooking School
episodes.overview: Back-to-school season isn't just for kids! The Kitchen hosts are teaching new recipes and techniques, starting with Chicken Marsala and 3-2-1-1 Vinaigrette. There's also Zoo Mix for an after-school snack for kids, and Bobby Flay stops by for a chat.

episodes.name: Tailgate Across America
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts recreate the best local dishes from football tailgates across America, starting with an Upstate-Style Roast Beef Sandwich. They also make Cincinnati-Style Chili and the ultimate Giant Peanut Butter Dark Chocolate Sea Salt Buckeyes.

episodes.name: Grocery Game Plan
episodes.overview: Proving that even the professionals use shortcuts, The Kitchen hosts each pick one supermarket staple to use in an easy weeknight dish. Their chosen ingredients include frozen garlic and ginger cubes, French onion soup mix and puff pastry dough.

episodes.name: Let's Dinner Party
episodes.overview: "The Kitchen" eases back into entertaining with a creamy burrata and sweet fig appetizer, easy white bean and mushroom soup and pan-roasted filet mignon with green peppers; there's also dessert, plus a game to get party guests laughing.

episodes.name: Halloween How-To Headquarters
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts have creepy Halloween creations and recipes for kids of all ages, including Graveyard Chicken Enchiladas and Roasted Pumpkin Pasta. Plus, the hosts share a Dead Velvet Cake, leftover candy treats and unforgettable scares!

episodes.name: Trends Worth Trying
episodes.overview: The Kitchen shares the trends that are worth making in your own kitchen, including a Chili Crisp Egg Bowl, Whipped Feta Dip and Cashew Cheese Sauce. Plus, the hosts lead a hack attack with the viral kitchen tips you'll want to try!

episodes.name: Recipe Swap!
episodes.overview: The Kitchen shakes things up with a new-school take on a recipe swap, where each host shares a dish made in another's signature style. Short Rib Bourguignon Over Creamy Polenta, Crunchy Orange French Toast, Pumpkin-Spiced Irish Coffee and more.

episodes.name: Fabulous Friendsgiving
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts throw a Friendsgiving party that kicks off with toasted mulled cider margaritas, and baked brie with cranberry chutney and toasted almonds; roasted turkey and root vegetables and mini pumpkin spice latte puddings for dessert.

episodes.name: Back to Thanksgiving Basics
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts explore Turkey Day basics with essential recipes and tips for every home cook; there's a butterflied roast turkey with easy orange spice rub, creamy potato puree, creamy green bean salad and classic chess pie for dessert.

episodes.name: Retro Cocktail Party
episodes.overview: The Kitchen throws it back to iconic party bites that deserve a comeback -- with new twists! There's a fabulous fon-duo of Taleggio Fondue and Quick Horchata Fondue as well as Mini Beef Wellington Bites and Retro Rum Ginger Pomegranate Punch.

episodes.name: The Kitchen's Holiday Inspo
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts share their inspired dishes for a festive holiday feast, from Super Cheesy Hometown Lasagna to Fried Shrimp with AtomiCocktail Sauce. Molly and John McCook of Food Network's first-ever movie, Candy Coated Christmas, stop by, too.

episodes.name: Roasts and Toasts
episodes.overview: The Kitchen gets cosy with festive roasts and toasts, starting with Sunny's Winning Pesto and Ricotta Crostini and Geoffrey's Tostones with Tuna Tartare and Adobo Chili. The hosts also make Easier Porchetta and a Champagne Cocktail.

episodes.name: Bottomless Brunch
episodes.overview: The Kitchen throws a bottomless brunch that starts with Bacon, Egg and Cheese Slider Casserole. The hosts collaborate on a Continental Brunch Board, and the menu also includes Loaded Home Fries and Sheet Pan Swirl Pancakes.

episodes.name: Feel Good Family Faves
episodes.overview: The Kitchen gives beloved family recipes a feel-good makeover, starting with Spicy Pork Loin and Lettuce Wraps. There's also a nonalcoholic Dry-Tai, Chocolate Cheesecake with Strawberry Topping and Post-Workout Lemon Poppy Seed Bars.

episodes.name: Cravings and Savings
episodes.overview: The hosts make satisfying recipes, like Banana Birthday Cake, without breaking the bank. There's Roast Chicken with Taqueria-Style Green Sauce, and the leftovers turn into Easy Chicken Tortilla Soup. Ebonée Noel from OWN's The Kings of Napa stops by.

episodes.name: Eat Local
episodes.overview: "The Kitchen" hosts share the local food traditions they love; there's an old-world Chicago-style thin crust pizza, white bean, cherry tomato and sausage orecchiette, easy raspberry and strawberry danishes, and a Florida-inspired fried fish sandwich.

episodes.name: A Week of Winter Meals
episodes.overview: The Kitchen lines up a week's worth of simple, crowd-pleasing weeknight meals, starting with Slow Cooker Chili and Baked Curry Tofu. There's also a shortcut Southwestern Pot Pie and Nunya Business Buffalo Chicken Garlic Bread Pizza.

episodes.name: Big Game Party Playbook
episodes.overview: "The Kitchen" hosts have play-by-play rules for hosting the perfect big game party, including a new spin on buffalo chicken enchiladas, spicy salami mozzarella sticks and a brewsky sour.

episodes.name: The Sweetest Pairings
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts share sweet and exciting flavor pairings that taste buds will love. Jeff Mauro pairs sweet and savory with his Pomegranate Glazed Lamb Lollipops with Feta Tzatziki. Alex Guarnaschelli whips up a sweet and bitter Endive Salad with Candied Nuts, Orange Caramel Dressing, and Blue Cheese. Katie Lee Biegel makes a sweet and sour Agrodolce Salmon, and Geoffrey Zakarian couples sweet with salty for his Chocolate Budino with Olive Oil and Salt. Plus, chocolate cocktails, mocktails and special guest Anne Burrell!

episodes.name: Picture Perfect Plates
episodes.overview: The Kitchen is cooking the most shareable, Instagrammable dishes ever! Geoffrey Zakarian whips up a Spring Pasta with Mushrooms, Chilies and Spring Peas. Alex Guarnaschelli makes picturesque Shrimp with a Yuzu Dressing. Then, the hosts share beautiful garnishes to elevate dishes to "picture perfect" status, and Katie Lee Biegel shares a trendy, fun dish -- Korean Corn Dogs with Boom Boom Sauce! The pink party begins when Jeff Mauro throws together his "Loloccino" AKA Strawberry Vanilla Shake Up, and Geoffrey shakes up a Pink Gin Martini!

episodes.name: Childhood Faves, Grown-Up Flavs
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts are putting new and delicious grown-up spins on favorite childhood comfort foods. Jeff Mauro updates a childhood classic with his Mortadella and Fig Pizza Bagel and Chicago-Style Deep Dish Pizza Bagel. Alex Guarnaschelli takes the ultimate kid party food to the next level with her Pretzel-ish Pigs in a Blanket with Mustard Sauce, and Katie Lee Biegel shares a mashup with her Philly Cheesesteak Sloppy Joe. Geoffrey Zakarian elevates everyone's favorite childhood sandwich with his PB&J Creme Brulee. Plus, brilliant ways to up your cereal game, and Molly Yeh stops by!

episodes.name: Ingredient Relay
episodes.overview: On your mark ... get set ... cook! Each Kitchen host cooks with a pantry staple, then passes it to another host for a different recipe idea. Jeff Mauro serves up his Buttermilk Brined Pork Chop, and Alex Guarnaschelli tosses her Chopped Iceberg Salad with Buttermilk Dressing and Crispy Chickpeas. Katie Lee Biegel makes a spin on a childhood favorite: Cheeseburger Chickpea Skillet, and Jeff reinvents the pinwheel with his Cheddar and Bacon Pinwheels. Geoffrey Zakarian ends on a sweet note with Mille Feuilles with Vanilla Pastry Cream and Bourbon Sauce.

episodes.name: Greatest Recipes in History!
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts are cooking up their takes on the greatest recipes in history! Katie Lee Biegel takes us back in time with her dinner party go-to, Chicken Marbella, and Alex Guarnaschelli throws together her take on a seafood classic, Crab Louis. Then, the hosts share new ways to use their favorite essential kitchen tools, and Jeff Mauro takes on an iconic duo and makes the best-ever Grilled Cheese and Creamy Tomato Soup. Geoffrey Zakarian shows off a fabulous flambe with his Crepe Suzette.

episodes.name: The Right Stuff!
episodes.overview: The Kitchen is stuffing everything in this flavorful, fun-filled show. Jeff Mauro's Spinach and Mushroom Stuffed Shells will leave you stuffed, and Katie Lee Biegel gives veggies a makeover with her Sausage Stuffed Onion. Geoffrey Zakarian makes a twist on "stuffies" -- Clams Oreganata with Harissa. Alex Guarnaschelli goes back to basics with her Classic Cream Puffs with Chocolate Sauce. Plus, the hosts share the trending stuffed foods the internet is buzzing about!

episodes.name: Perfect Plate of Spring
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts are sharing the ultimate menu for the perfect spring feast, from the main course to dessert. Alex Guarnaschelli kicks off the feast with the main course: Slow Cooked Brisket with Carrots, Brown Sugar and Gremolata. Katie Lee Biegel adds some citrus with her Lemon Caper Deviled Eggs and Lemon Meringue Pie Cupcakes. Geoffrey Zakarian's Spring Pea Salad with Jamon Ham and Mustard Vinaigrette is the perfect veggie side. Jeff Mauro and his son Lorenzo go on the ultimate spring break food tour. The hosts enjoy their spring feast together, and Katie Lee shows off some beautiful table decor using spring produce!

episodes.name: Delivery D-I-Y
episodes.overview: The Kitchen is sharing twists on takeout and making delivery favorites at home. Alex Guarnaschelli freshens up Orange Peel Chicken, and Geoffrey Zakarian has got the secrets to Souvlaki. Jeff Mauro debuts an epic Giant Double Decker Taco, and Katie Lee Biegel's Spicy Pork Lettuce Wraps come together in a snap. Plus, the hosts have some kitchen hack attacks that will change your life.

episodes.name: "Mom-spirational" Meals
episodes.overview: The Kitchen co-hosts are celebrating the amazing moms in their lives with recipes and crafts inspired by them! Geoffrey Zakarian toasts moms with his Rose Elderflower Sangria and whips up Savory Lamb Sliders. Jeff Mauro honors his own mother with Pam's Shrimp and Pea Pasta, and Alex Guarnaschelli makes her Fresh Griddled Flatbread. Sunny Anderson gets crafty with her DIY Mother's Day gifts, and Katie Lee Biegel shares her grandma's award-winning Angel Food Cake recipe!

episodes.name: Get That Dinner Done!
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts have shortcuts, easy recipes and tips for flavorful weeknight meals. Geoffrey Zakarian makes a quick and easy Peanut Sauce over Shrimp Skewers and Rice Noodles. Jeff Mauro has a twist on a classic with a Turkey Reuben, and Katie Lee Biegel makes Easy Veggie Marinara Ravioli Bake in mere minutes. Alex Guarnaschelli's Chicken Cutlets "Saltimbocca" with Prosciutto and Sage "jumps in your mouth." Plus, the hosts share instant upgrades for everyday meals, and Jet Tila stops by!

episodes.name: All You Can Eat BBQ
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts are cooking up big batch BBQ dishes, including grilled meats, for a great summer party! Sunny Anderson kicks off the all-you-can-eat feast with her Easy Smokehouse Burger. Geoffrey Zakarian whips up his Herbed Potato Salad, a staple side with a fresh twist. Alex Guarnaschelli satisfies the sweet tooth with her Glazed Funnel Cakes, and Katie Lee Biegel adds a pop of color with her Purple Cauliflower and Red Cabbage Slaw. Jeff Mauro puts a smoky twist on a seafood tower with his Epic BBQ Tower!

episodes.name: The Kitchen's Take on Trends
episodes.overview: The Kitchen co-hosts put their spins on the hottest trends in the food world. Katie Lee Biegel busts out the air fryer to make her Summer Fish Fry. Sunny Anderson weighs in on some of social media's hottest trends and makes her Twisted Bacon in "Tik Tok It or Knock It!" Alex Guarnaschelli jumps on the plant-based meals trend with her Cheesy, Stuffed Portobello Mushroom Burgers. Jeff Mauro and the gang play a game on how to "Compost Like A Champ!" Geoffrey Zakarian finishes with dessert and makes a Chocolate Oat Milk Budino with Balsamic Strawberries.

episodes.name: Summer Steakhouse Dinner
episodes.overview: The Kitchen co-hosts make a summery steakhouse menu to celebrate Father's Day! Jeff Mauro and Geoffrey Zakarian make an epic surf 'n' turf with Jeff's Chicago Steakhouse Peppercorn-Crusted Filet and GZ's Crab au Poivre. Sunny Anderson lightens up the steakhouse with her Green Goddess Twice Baked Potatoes, and Katie Lee Biegel makes her greatest salad yet: Barbeque Bacon Wedge Salad with Grilled Corn. Alex Guarnaschelli whips up a luscious and bright Frozen Strawberry Pie, and the co-hosts share their favorite summer wines.

episodes.name: Eat with Your Hands!
episodes.overview: No utensils allowed in The Kitchen's handheld feast filled with apps, mains and sweets! Sunny Anderson grills up Easy Chicken Taco Skewers. Geoffrey Zakarian makes fancy finger food: Spicy Tuna Tartare. Alex Guarnaschelli raises a toast to summer with her Raspberry Bourbon Sour. Katie Lee Biegel brings the family together with her Garlic and Herb Pull-Apart Bread. Jeff Mauro and Sunny go head-to-head in a Top Dog Hot Dog Competition with Jeff's Flamin' Greek Style Cheese Dog and Sunny's Award-Winning Curry-Style Hot Dog!

episodes.name: Fireworks Feast
episodes.overview: The Kitchen co-hosts are making colorful, spicy and sparkling foods to celebrate Independence Day. Geoffrey Zakarian gets festive with his Dry Rubbed Hanger Steak with Smoky Aioli and Charred Peppers. Sunny Anderson makes a dish with a hometown spin, her Sweet Quick Kenner Maque Choux. Jeff Mauro brings the heat with his Crispy Oven-Fried M-80 Chicken Wings. Katie Lee Biegel supplies the Independence Day veggies, Blue Cheese Stuffed Tomatoes. Then, Jeff shows off some bartending flair with a Star Spangled Spirit.

episodes.name: K-I-S-S (Keep It Simple Summer)
episodes.overview: The Kitchen co-hosts are making easy, breezy recipes perfect for summer nights. Jeff Mauro and Sunny Anderson team up to make the perfect main and side: Marinated Chicken and Sunny's Simple Summertime Couscous Salad. Then, the hosts play "Taste It or Toss It" with trendy condiments, and Alex Guarnaschelli makes a Honey Vinegar Glaze. Geoffrey Zakarian goes classic with his Linguine with Clams, and Katie Lee Biegel wows with her Coconut Tres Leches Cake. American Detective's Joe Kenda stops by to discuss his new shows and sip an Espresso Old Fashioned.

episodes.name: Foolproof Alfresco
episodes.overview: The Kitchen co-hosts cook up recipes perfect for a trip to the park, beach or anywhere outside! Jeff Mauro passes the giant Pork Milanese Sub, and Katie Lee Biegel shares the best "Pack It and Snack It" tips to enjoy food in the great outdoors. Alex Guarnaschelli whips up Hoisin Sauce Noodles with Chicken, and Sunny Anderson bakes her PB&J Swirl Bars. Geoffrey Zakarian takes his Cucumber Vodka Cooler on the go, and Jeff shows how to make a Mobile Mai Tai.

episodes.name: Summer Recipe Swap
episodes.overview: The Kitchen co-hosts try something new and swap styles with each other! Katie Lee Biegel cooks up a Cacio e Pepe with Fresh Corn, and Geoffrey Zakarian takes on No-Bake Peaches and Cream Cheesecake Cups. Sunny Anderson serves up her Lobster Tail "Newberg," and Alex Guarnaschelli loads up her Summer Vegetable Calzones. Jeff Mauro takes some inspiration from all his co-hosts and throws together Kitchen Family Nachos!

episodes.name: Craveable and Colorful Creations
episodes.overview: The Kitchen is serving up the most colorful dishes that kids will love to make and eat. Jeff Mauro makes his son Lorenzo's favorite Pulled Pork and Veggie Rice Bowls. The co-hosts share some of their favorite kid cooks on social media and then chat with mini-chef Mina. Sunny Anderson makes Multi-Colored Waffles, and Katie Lee Biegel flips the script with her Colorful Veggie Quesadilla. Geoffrey Zakarian asks his co-hosts whether they would "Buy or D-I-Y" iconic food trends, and Alex Guarnaschelli makes a nostalgic favorite: Homemade Toaster Pastries.

episodes.name: What We Ate on Summer Vacation
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts send taste buds on summer vacation with their favorite dishes! Geoffrey Zakarian makes a buttery Connecticut Lobster Roll to start. Jeff Mauro heads to the Caribbean with his Jerk Pan Jerk Chicken, and Chef Kathy Fang stops by to chat about her new show. Sunny Anderson prepares a refreshing "Tropical" Tuna Ceviche, Alex Guarnaschelli puts her spin on Charred Peppers and Sausage Hero Sandwiches, and Katie Lee Biegel makes cool and creamy Hawaiian Shaved Ice. Plus, the hosts play a vacation edition of Try or Deny.

episodes.name: Cool for the Summer
episodes.overview: The Kitchen's serving up easy, breezy recipes to cool things down in the dog days of summer! Katie Lee Biegel puts together a Ginger Garlic Steak and Noodle Salad. Geoffrey Zakarian whips up a refreshing Red and White Gazpacho, and Jeff Mauro makes his Famous Chicken Salad Croissant Sandwich. Sunny Anderson keeps cool with Chia Seed Oat Milk Puddings, and Alex Guarnaschelli beats the heat with Pickled Watermelon!

episodes.name: Cookout Combos
episodes.overview: Sick of the same old cookout recipes? The Kitchen is mixing things up with creative and delicious combos of cookout favorites! Jeff Mauro combines two cookout staples to make BBQ Chicken Fajitas, and Sunny Anderson turns a classic dish into a go-to party snack with her Gyro Dip. Katie Lee Biegel brings the sweet and the heat with her Honey Garlic Chili Burgers and Chipotle Lime Baked Beans. Geoffrey Zakarian proves that two salads are better than one with his Caesar Pasta Salad, and Alex Guarnaschelli tries some wacky ice cream toppings.

episodes.name: The Kitchen's Hack Attack
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts cut down on cooking time with time-saving hacks, ingredients and gadgets to get dinner on the table -- fast! Sunny Anderson saves time (and dishes) with her Oktoberfest Cheat Sheet. The hosts share new hacks for the old tools you already have in your kitchen. Iron Chef Geoffrey Zakarian makes Salmon with Maître D’Hôtel Butter and Asparagus ... in the microwave?! Katie Lee Biegel spices up weeknight chicken with her Falafel Chicken Cutlet. Plus, the hosts give the latest TikTok trends a taste test drive!

episodes.name: #GameDayGoals
episodes.overview: The Kitchen aims to score all the likes with the coolest, trendiest game day party foods! Katie Lee Biegel packs flavor into her Buffalo Chicken Tot-chos, while Alex Guarnaschelli makes a Spiked Earl Grey Lemonade that's perfect for tailgating. Jeff Mauro levels up carbs with an epic Loaded Cream Cheese Bread. The hosts take a look at the latest taco trends, then Geoffrey Zakarian is on the grill pan with his easy and tasty Grilled Fish Tacos with Papaya Slaw. Sunny Anderson steals the show with her Cookie Butter Cookies. Plus, the hosts present their first ever Kitchen Bowl competition!

episodes.name: Red Sauce Recipes
episodes.overview: The Kitchen co-hosts put their own unique touches on delicious Italian recipes from red sauce joints. The whole crew works together to make The Kitchen Family's Sunday Sauce, Alex Guarnaschelli brings dessert to the feast with her Classic Tiramisu and Geoffrey Zakarian whips up a Tricolore Salad. Jeff Mauro makes the Ultimate Cheesy Chicken Parmesan, while Sunny Anderson and Katie Lee Biegel create two types of garlic bread: Cushy and Crispy Garlic Bread and Stovetop Garlic Bread!

episodes.name: Summer Recipe Swap
episodes.overview: The Kitchen co-hosts try something new and swap styles with each other! Katie Lee Biegel cooks up a Cacio e Pepe with Fresh Corn, and Geoffrey Zakarian takes on No-Bake Peaches and Cream Cheesecake Cups. Sunny Anderson serves up her Lobster Tail "Newberg," and Alex Guarnaschelli loads up her Summer Vegetable Calzones. Jeff Mauro takes some inspiration from all his co-hosts and throws together Kitchen Family Nachos!

episodes.name: Craveable and Colorful Creations
episodes.overview: The Kitchen is serving up the most colorful dishes that kids will love to make and eat. Jeff Mauro makes his son Lorenzo's favorite Pulled Pork and Veggie Rice Bowls. The co-hosts share some of their favorite kid cooks on social media and then chat with mini-chef Mina. Sunny Anderson makes Multi-Colored Waffles, and Katie Lee Biegel flips the script with her Colorful Veggie Quesadilla. Geoffrey Zakarian asks his co-hosts whether they would "Buy or D-I-Y" iconic food trends, and Alex Guarnaschelli makes a nostalgic favorite: Homemade Toaster Pastries.

episodes.name: What We Ate on Summer Vacation
episodes.overview: The Kitchen hosts send taste buds on summer vacation with their favorite dishes! Geoffrey Zakarian makes a buttery Connecticut Lobster Roll to start. Jeff Mauro heads to the Caribbean with his Jerk Pan Jerk Chicken, and Chef Kathy Fang stops by to chat about her new show. Sunny Anderson prepares a refreshing "Tropical" Tuna Ceviche, Alex Guarnaschelli puts her spin on Charred Peppers and Sausage Hero Sandwiches, and Katie Lee Biegel makes cool and creamy Hawaiian Shaved Ice. Plus, the hosts play a vacation edition of Try or Deny.

episodes.name: Cool for the Summer
episodes.overview: The Kitchen's serving up easy, breezy recipes to cool things down in the dog days of summer! Katie Lee Biegel puts together a Ginger Garlic Steak and Noodle Salad. Geoffrey Zakarian whips up a refreshing Red and White Gazpacho, and Jeff Mauro makes his Famous Chicken Salad Croissant Sandwich. Sunny Anderson keeps cool with Chia Seed Oat Milk Puddings, and Alex Guarnaschelli beats the heat with Pickled Watermelon!

episodes.name: Cookout Combos
episodes.overview: Sick of the same old cookout recipes? The Kitchen is mixing things up with creative and delicious combos of cookout favorites! Jeff Mauro combines two cookout staples to make BBQ Chicken Fajitas, and Sunny Anderson turns a classic dish into a go-to party snack with her Gyro Dip. Katie Lee Biegel brings the sweet and the heat with her Honey Garlic Chili Burgers and Chipotle Lime Baked Beans. Geoffrey Zakarian proves that two salads are better than one with his Caesar Pasta Salad, and Alex Guarnaschelli tries some wacky ice cream toppings.

Sunny Anderson saves time (and dishes) with her Oktoberfest Cheat Sheet. The hosts share new hacks for the old tools you already have in your kitchen. Iron Chef Geoffrey Zakarian makes Salmon with Maître D'Hôtel Butter and Asparagus ... in the microwave?! Katie Lee Biegel spices up weeknight chicken with her Falafel Chicken Cutlet. Plus, the hosts give the latest TikTok trends a taste test drive!
